result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith L Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Keith L Adams is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Keith L Adams was found guilty of False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Keith L Adams was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs, assessments and fees, including mandatory surcharges in this action (Counts 2 and 3) during period of probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Successfully complete Batterer's Intervention Programming.
Random urine screens.
Cooperate fully with probation agent.
Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.
AODA assessment and comply with treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keith L Adams

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA AND SENTENCING Transcript (32 pages) commencing JUNE 12, 2014 received and filed. kl
Reflects 09-25-15 Court order imposing 60 days of condition time
Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Condtions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed (60 days straight time).  rmm
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld
Court ordered no contact with the victim unless approved by the agent.

Defendant Keith L Adams in court.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

AS TO COUNT 1:  On motion of the state, Court ordered Count 1 dismissed.
.
AS TO COUNTS 4 AND 5:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
.
AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3 AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
*
  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements made as to sentencing.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT OF 5 YEARS, with credit for 2 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  
.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program; is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
.
Court IMPOSED BUT STAYED the Sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:
-Defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, STAYED.
-Successfully complete Batterer's Intervention Programming.
-AODA assessment and comply with treatment.
-No illegal substances.
-Random urine screens.
-No Contact with the victim unless approved by the Court.
-Possess no firearms or dangerous weapons.
-Cooperate fully with probation agent.
-Maintain full time employment or attend school.
-Obtain GED or HSED.
-Pay all court costs, assessments and fees, including mandatory surcharges in this action (Counts 2 and 3) during period of Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
-Court denied the request for expungement.
.
AS TO COUNT 3:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 89 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 89 days time served.  THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
.
Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.

Defendant Keith L Adams in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant Keith L Adams in custody.  Ryan T Sanson for Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:  On motion of the State, Court ordered penalty enhancers, USE OF A DANGEROUS WEAPON, dismissed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Awni M Yasin in court, defendant Keith L Adams not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Defendant would like to enter a plea but due to court calendar, it could not be heard on this date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Keith L Adams in court with attorney Awni M. Yasin.  Defendant Keith L Adams in custody.  Molly Marie Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Defense motion to dismiss Count 1 for deficiency of the complaint heard.  For reasons stated on the record, Court denied the motion.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JEROME F.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Keith L Adams in court with attorney Melissa J. Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Keith L Adams in custody.  Karine E. O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DALLET, Branch 40.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 40.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
